texts.definition: Meta Servers are the servers that distribute players and information between game servers of a specific game as well as stores global information about the players.
markups: <style="Definition">Meta Servers are the servers that distribute players and information between game servers of a specific game as well as stores global information about the players.</style>

Online games are typically constructed around the concept of a game servers which people log onto to play. For games with more people that want to play than the individual game instances can support, <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> can function as a service to lead players to free servers as well as provide community functionality such as being able to find on which game servers one's friends are playing.

Most <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Online%20Games">Online Games</link></style> using <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Servers</link></style> also make use of <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> so that players have some place to connect to when they wish to play. Examples of this can be found in many genres: the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Unreal%20Tournament%20series">Unreal Tournament</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Quake%20series">Quake series</link></style> for <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-Person Shooters</link></style>; <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Eve%20Online">Eve Online</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ultima%20Online">Ultima Online</link></style> for <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Massively%20Multiplayer%20Online%20Games">Massively Multiplayer Online Games</link></style>;

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Social%20Media%20Games">Social Media Games</link></style> with limited interaction between players, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Candy%20Crush%20Saga">Candy Crush Saga</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/FarmVille">FarmVille</link></style>, many have <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> but this is hidden from players since they never need to log onto specific <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Servers</link></style>.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Massively%20Multiplayer%20Online%20Games">MUDs</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/BatMUD">BatMUD</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/DragonMud">DragonMud</link></style> are examples of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Online%20Games">Online Games</link></style> that due to how they are created and maintained by players only reside on single <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Servers</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Eve%20Online">Eve Online</link></style> is a rare example of a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Massively%20Multiplayer%20Online%20Games">Massively Multiplayer Online Games</link></style> that by having only one <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Server</link></style> can ensure that all action players take can have a persistent effect on the game and that all narratives that emerge from playing the game relates to the same game instance.

The prime reason for using <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> is to augment <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Servers</link></style> and help players connect to the <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Servers</link></style> suiting their needs or desires. <style="Link"><link="game-lobbies">Game Lobbies</link></style> are common solution for fulfilling the second reason, although games with <style="Link"><link="private-game-spaces">Private Game Spaces</link></style> do not need them (this in practice typically means <style="Link"><link="massively-single-player-online-games">Massively Single-Player Online Games</link></style>).

Given that <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> fulfill these reasons, there are various types of functionality that they can offer players. <style="Link"><link="friend-lists">Friend Lists</link></style> lets players find each other, e.g. locating with <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Server</link></style> a friend is currently playing on so one can join him or her there. <style="Link"><link="player-kicking">Player Kicking</link></style> allows players or game facilitators to regulate how can play based upon their behavior (although this might be more commonly used per <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Server</link></style>). <style="Link"><link="chat-channels">Chat Channels</link></style> let players communicate outside the game, which for example can lead to more consensus in relation to the two previous forms of functionality. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Global%20High%20Score%20Lists">Global High Score Lists</link></style> lets players compare themselves with all other players of the game as well as store <style="Link"><link="gameplay-statistics">Gameplay Statistics</link></style> between game instances.

Regardless of the specific functionality the <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> are to provide, they typically do so by collecting <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Trans-Game%20Information">Trans-Game Information</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="gameplay-statistics">Gameplay Statistics</link></style> from the <style="Link"><link="game-servers">Game Servers</link></style>. If these are to be used to explicitly create <style="Link"><link="meta-games">Meta Games</link></style> is a design option when creating <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> but in many cases this is more or less unavoidable, e.g. when storing and presenting <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Global%20High%20Score%20Lists">Global High Score Lists</link></style>.

The possibility of <style="CurrentLink">Meta Servers</style> to store <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Trans-Game%20Information">Trans-Game Information</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Global%20High%20Score%20Lists">Global High Score Lists</link></style> make them support <style="Link"><link="meta-games">Meta Games</link></style> built upon the statistics, <style="Link"><link="scores">Scores</link></style>, etc. that the players gain or loss in the individual games.
